caffe.launcher.desc: Path to script that launches Caffe benchmarks.

caffe.env.desc: An string that defines export variables that's used to initialize environment for Caffe.

desc: A fork of Caffe. Possible values may vary including 'bvlc', 'nvidia' and 'intel'. The value
of this parameter is computed automatically. The only reason why it has default value (bvlc)
is because there are other parameters referencing this parameter that need to be resolved.

caffe.action.desc: Action that needs to be performed by caffe. Possible values are 'train' or 'time'.

caffe.model_dir.desc: Directory where Caffe's model file is located. Different for host/docker benchmarks.

desc: Overlap compute and communication for data parallel training. This can be useful to benchmark
hardware components that are responsible/involved in gradient reduction. Only original BVLC Caffe
supports this. Intel/NVIDIA bechmarks with this variable set to false will be disabled.

caffe.solver.desc: A content for a Caffe's solver file in case Caffe benchmarks train phase.

caffe.args.desc: Command line arguments that launcher uses to launch Caffe.

caffe.data_dir.desc: A data directory if real data should be used. If empty, synthetic data is used (no data ingestion pipeline).

caffe.mirror.desc: In case of real data, specifies if 'mirrowing' should be applied.

caffe.data_mean_file.desc: In case of real data, specifies path to an image mean file.

caffe.data_mean_file_path.desc: If data mean file is present, this variable contains path to that file. Do not change this variable.

caffe.data_mean_file_name.desc: If data mean file is present, this variable contains name of that file. Do not change this variable.

caffe.data_backend.desc: In case of real data, specifies its storage backend ('LMDB' or 'LEVELDB').

caffe.host_path.desc: Path to a caffe executable in case of bare metal run.

caffe.docker_image.desc: The name of a docker image to use.

caffe.docker_args.desc: In case if containerized benchmarks, this are the docker parameters.

bvlc_caffe.host_path.desc: Path to a BVLC Caffe executable in case of a bare metal run.

bvlc_caffe.host_libpath.desc: Basically, it's a LD_LIBRARY_PATH for BVLC Caffe in case of a bare metal run.

bvlc_caffe.docker_image.desc: The name of a docker image to use for BVLC Caffe.

bvlc_caffe.data_dir.desc: A data directory if real data should be used. If empty, synthetic data is used (no data ingestion pipeline).

nvidia_caffe.host_path.desc: Path to a NVIDIA Caffe executable in case of a bare metal run.

nvidia_caffe.host_libpath.desc: Basically, it's a LD_LIBRARY_PATH for NVIDIA Caffe in case of a bare metal run.

nvidia_caffe.docker_image.desc: The name of a docker image to use for NVIDIA Caffe.

nvidia_caffe.data_dir.desc: A data directory if real data should be used. If empty, synthetic data is used (no data ingestion pipeline).

desc: Parameter that specifies what components in NVIDIA Caffe use what precision:
float32   Use FP32 for training values storage and matrix-mult accumulator.
float16   Use FP16 for training values storage and matrix-mult accumulator
mixed     Use FP16 for training values storage and FP32 for matrix-mult accumulator
More fine-grained control over these values can be done by directly manipulating
Default value depends on exp.dtype parameters:
exp.dtype == int32   -> nvidia_caffe.precision is set to float32 and experiment will notbe ran
Precision for a solver (FLOAT, FLOAT16). Only for NVIDIA Caffe.
Precision for a forward pass (FLOAT, FLOAT16). Only for NVIDIA Caffe.
Precision for a backward pass (FLOAT, FLOAT16). Only for NVIDIA Caffe.
Precision for a forward math (FLOAT, FLOAT16). Only for NVIDIA Caffe.
Precision for a backward math (FLOAT, FLOAT16). Only for NVIDIA Caffe.

intel_caffe.host_path.desc: Path to an Intel Caffe executable in case of a bare metal run.

intel_caffe.host_libpath.desc: Basically, it's a LD_LIBRARY_PATH for Intel Caffe in case of a bare metal run.

intel_caffe.docker_image.desc: The name of a docker image to use for Intel Caffe.

intel_caffe.data_dir.desc: A data directory if real data should be used. If empty, synthetic data is used (no data ingestion pipeline).

parameters.exp.status_message: NVIDIA/Intel Caffe forks do not support 'caffe.layer_wise_reduce' option set to 'false'.
